area_name: Carr's Pond Boulders in the Big River Management Area

content.description: Follow a sharp arete at the back end of Shorty's boulder. make a move to the face and top out.
content.protection: Use pads as the only way to get off involves jumping or climbing down.
content.location: Left most arete on the back of Shorty's Boulder. Start in a layback on an obvious fin.

content.description: Make a big move off the start and follow with short beta intensive moves on decent holds with careful footwork to the top out.
content.protection: Use crash pads as you have to climb/jump down from the boulder to get off.
content.location: On the back of Shorty's Boulder. The start is a small flake jug that stands out clearly from the rest of the rock.

content.description: Start on high edge, then throw to a good hold and make a move to the topout.
content.protection: Use lots of pads to cover a rock below the start of the route.
content.location: The route is to the right of the topout of Mutiny on the Treasure Island Boulder.

content.description: Move from slab into good undercling cracks, while moving along the top edge of the boulder, until the crack ends, when there are good holds to top out on.
content.protection: Use pads because the fall is rocky and there may be trees in the way.
content.location: Follow the blunt arete closest to the trail. It is located on the front right arete of the Treasure Island boulder.To get down go down a divet in the back of the boulder.

content.description: Follow slab with small holds and good feet to the top out.
content.protection: Use pads because the fall involves a large tree.
content.location: Located on the face of the Treasure Island Boulder closest to the trail.

pathTokens: Carr's Pond Boulders in the Big River Management Area

content.description: Bouldering in a beautiful wooded setting. The boulders are fine grained granite with some features and few feet.
